intro: Draba lutescens, commonly known as the yellow whitlowgrass, is a small flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its cruciform flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. Its yellow flowers, which bloom in early spring, are small and clustered, adding a delicate touch to its habitat. Draba lutescens is often found in alpine meadows and scree slopes, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
